'''Roger Garland''' was an English artist, teacher and [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] illustrator. 


==History==
[[File:Roger Garland - The Lord of the Nazgul.JPG|300px|thumb|right|''The Lord of the Nazgûl'' by '''Roger Garland''']]
Roger Garland attended [[wikipedia:Arts University Plimouth|Plymouth Art School]] and studied graphic design at the [[wikipedia: University of Wolverhampton|University of Wolverhampton]], where he met his wife [[Linda Garland]].<ref name=gallery>[http://www.lakeside-gallery.com/  lakesidegallery.com](accessed 19 April 2023)</ref> Both graduated in [[1970]].<ref name=gallery /><ref>[https://web.facebook.com/roger.garland.3  Roger Garland] on Facebook (accessed 20 April 2023)</ref> Their son Seth Garland (born [[1977]]) is also an artist.<ref>[http://www.sethgarland.co.uk/#about  sethgarland.com] (accessed 16 May 2023)</ref> After graduating, Garland taught art at the [[wikipedia: Poltair School|Poltair School]] in [[wikipedia: Cornwall|Cornwall]] for a decade, while also building a career as an illustrator.<ref name=gallery /> His first collaboration with [[George Allen & Unwin]] was in [[1981]],<ref name=gallery /> when he was hired to paint a cover for the paperback release of [[Unfinished Tales]]. In 1989, he co-founded Lakeside Gallery with his wife, which permanently displays their artwork, including Roger's Tolkien-related paintings, to this day.<ref name=gallery /> Some of these paintings were part of the italian exhibition [[TOLKIEN - Uomo, Professore, Autore| ''Tolkien: Uomo, Professore, Autore'']], that toured between 2023 and 2026. In his opinion, ''[[:File:Roger Garland - The Lord of the Nazgul.JPG| The Lord of the Nazgûl]]'' is his best painting, because it "''captures the darker side of these works''".<ref>[https://www.sociedadtolkien.org/blog/2017/10/26/fallece-el-ilustrador-roger-garland/?highlight=roger%20garland  Fallece el ilustrador Roger Garland] at sociedadtolkien.org (quote translated back from Spanish, original not found)(accessed 19 April 2023)</ref> He was also an honorary member of [[The Tolkien Society]] since [[1994]].<ref>[https://www.tolkiensociety.org/2017/10/tolkien-illustrator-roger-garland-has-died/  Tolkien illustrator Roger Garland has died] at tolkiensociety.org (accessed 19 April 2023)</ref>
